pageContext.description: A lovely specimen in perfect condition. Very pronounced casting ridges down sides, not central. Socket oblong with rounded angles. Roll moulding below rim flanked by fillets.
pageContext.patina: Lustrous black patina with brown, green & reddish lights. Red-gold metal shows on inner lip.
pageContext.surface: smooth; shows oval hammer markings on both faces towards edge.
pageContext.publications: W.H. Richardson exhibited to the Society of Antiquaries, 28th January, 1904; , Proc. Soc. Antiq., XX. 33-35:, British Museum, E.I.A. Guide (1925) p. 88 (ref. above).
pageContext.collection: Private collection, [...] Phyllis M. Tilley, Upper Astrop, King's Sutton, Bunbury., Bought from the finder by the Tate, Leonard G. Slade, Esq., Manor Farm, Blenbury, Berks., Drawn by Lily F. Chitty, 22nd Jan. 1941.
pageContext.site: England, Berkshire, Hagbourne, West, Hagbourne Hill, Precise site not ascertainable, Found by a shepherd in pitching a fold, 1893, summer of.
pageContext.toSearch: West Hagbourne, Didcot, Oxfordshire Ox11, United Kingdom
